titre: Réglementation IA européenne : guide de conformité pratique pour PME

corpusUtilise.titre: Réglementation IA européenne : guide de conformité pratique pour PME

extraits: The AI Act establishes product-specific regulations for artificial intelligence systems marketed within the EU.
It applies to all businesses developing, providing, or deploying AI systems and includes specific provisions for generative AI models.
Companies must assess their AI systems’ risk levels and adapt their compliance accordingly.
Compliance requirements vary depending on whether the AI model is open-source or not.
Specialised compliance tools, such as Naaia, have emerged to help organisations streamline compliance efforts.
The AI Act will enter into force on August 2, 2024.
February 2, 2025: Prohibited AI practices must be withdrawn from the market.
August 2, 2026: All rules become applicable, including obligations for high-risk systems.
Member States must establish at least one operational AI regulatory sandbox at national level.
Governance structure includes AI Office, European Artificial Intelligence Board, and national authorities.

sources.date: 07/09/2021 (mise à jour continue, dernière majeure en 2024)
extraits: The AI Act is a European Union regulation concerning artificial intelligence (AI).
It came into force on 1 August 2024, with provisions that shall come into operation gradually over the following 6 to 36 months.
The Act classifies AI applications by risk: unacceptable, high, limited, minimal, plus general-purpose AI.
High-risk applications must comply with security, transparency and quality obligations, and undergo conformity assessments.
The Act creates a European Artificial Intelligence Board to promote national cooperation and ensure compliance.

sources.type: Article sur le Code de Pratique GPAI
extraits: Starting on 2 August 2025, the AI Office will work closely with the Code of Practice signatories.
Providers not fully compliant immediately will be recognized for good-faith efforts.
Starting on 2 August 2026, the EU Commission will enforce all obligations and may impose fines.
The Code of Practice offers practical guidance to help providers comply with transparency, copyright, and safety obligations.
Several prominent GPAI model providers have indicated willingness to become signatories.
The AI Act entered into force on 1 August 2024, fully applicable on 2 August 2026.
General-purpose AI models carry systemic risks and must comply with transparency and risk mitigation rules.
The Commission introduced 3 key instruments to support compliance: Guidelines on GPAI obligations, GPAI Code of Practice, and Template for public summary of training content.
These tools reduce administrative burden and foster innovation while safeguarding fundamental rights.
Providers must disclose data sources and processing aspects to enable rights under EU law.

synthese.convergences: Toutes les sources confirment l’entrée en vigueur de l’AI Act en août 2024 avec une montée en charge progressive jusqu’en 2026-2027. La réglementation impose une classification des IA selon leur niveau de risque, avec des obligations renforcées pour les systèmes à haut risque et les modèles d’IA à usage général (GPAI). La conformité implique des évaluations de risque, des obligations de transparence, et la mise en place d’une gouvernance à plusieurs niveaux (EU, national, entreprise). Les PME/ETI doivent anticiper ces exigences, notamment en matière d’évaluation de risque et de documentation. Des outils et codes de pratique sont proposés pour faciliter la mise en conformité.
synthese.divergences: Peu de divergences majeures, mais un focus plus juridique et procédural dans les rapports d’avocats (source 2 et 4) versus un angle plus opérationnel et pratique dans les guides (source 1 et 5). Wikipédia offre une synthèse plus générale et moins détaillée sur les outils pratiques.
